alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 5:52PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN QUAY AND CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM MDT... At 552 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of San Jon to near Ranchvale. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Texico, San Jon, Grady, Glenrio, Ranchvale, Cannon Air Force Base, Broadview, Wheatland and Bellview. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 348 and 373. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 375 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
